Navigation

Use navigation to direct the user to products and services.

  1. Primary navigation
  2. Secondary navigation
  3. Breadcrumbs
  4. Sidebar navigation
  5. Tabs

1. Primary navigation

Use the primary navigation full width to highlight the top level navgigation. On hover it should reveal the child pages related to it.

Site Name

Close main menu
  • Section 1

    Subsection 1A

    • Page 1A1

    Subsection 1B

    • Page 1B1

    Subsection 1C

    • Page 1C1
    • Page 1C2
  • Section 2

    Etc...

    • Etc...

    Etc...

    • Etc.
  • Section 3

    Etc...

    • Etc...
Open main menu
HTML goes here.
Navigation object:
                
const navigation = {
                    heading: 'Site Name',
                    sections: [
        {
            title: 'Section 1',
            href: '/section1/',
            subSections: [
                    {
                    title: 'Subsection 1A',
                    href: '/section1/subsection-a',
                    items: [
                        { label: 'Page 1A1', href: '/section1/subsection-a/page1a1.html' },
                    ]
                },
                    {
                    title: 'Subsection 1B',
                    href: '/section1/subsection-b/',
                    items: [
                        { label: 'Page 1B1', href: '/section1/subsection-b/page1b1.html' },
                    ]
                },
                    {
                    title: 'Subsection 1C',
                    href: '/section1/subsection-c/',
                    items: [
                        { label: 'Page 1C1', href: '/section1/subsection-c/page1c1.html' },
                        { label: 'Page 1C2', href: '/section1/subsection-c/page1c2.html' },
                    ]
                },
            ]
        },
        {
            title: 'Section 2',
            href: '/section2/',
            subSections: [
                    {
                    title: 'Etc...',
                    href: '/section2/etc/',
                    items: [
                        { label: 'Etc...', href: '/section2/etc/etc' },
                    ]
                },
                    {
                    title: 'Etc',
                    href: '/section2/etc/',
                    items: [
                        { label: 'Etc...', href: '/section2/etc/etc' },
                    ]
                },
            ]
        },
        {
            title: 'Section 3',
            href: '/section3/',
            subSections: [
                    {
                    title: 'Etc...',
                    href: '/section3/etc/',
                    items: [
                        { label: 'Etc...', href: '/section3/etc/etc' },
                    ]
                },
            ]
        },
    ]
}
Angular example usage:
            
 <app-navigation [navigation]="navigation"></app-navigation>

2. Secondary navigation

Use the secondary navigation full width to highlight core products and services or to access login services.

Site name
Link one Link two Link three
HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<section class="card"> <h6 *ngIf="title">Contact details</h6> <div> <ng-content> <form> <input type="text" placeholder="First name"/><br> <input type="text" placeholder="Last name"/><br> <input type="text" placeholder="Email address"/><br> </form> </ng-content> </div> </section>

Angular component:
                import {Component, Input, OnInit} from '@angular/core';

@Component({
                    selector: 'app-card',
                    templateUrl: './card.component.html',
                    styleUrls: ['./card.component.scss']
})
export class ExpansionComponent implements OnInit {
                    @Input() public title = '';

                    constructor() { }

  ngOnInit() {
  }

}
Angular template:
                <section class="card">
  <h6 *ngIf="title">{{ title }}</h6>
  <div>
    <ng-content></ng-content>
  </div>
</section>

3. Breadcrumbs

Use breadcrumbs on screen sizes down to 1024 pixels wide to show the user the site architecture

  • Homepage
  • Section 1
  • Item 2
  • Current page
HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<section class="card"> <h6 *ngIf="title">Contact details</h6> <div> <ng-content> <form> <input type="text" placeholder="First name"/><br> <input type="text" placeholder="Last name"/><br> <input type="text" placeholder="Email address"/><br> </form> </ng-content> </div> </section>

Angular component:
                import {Component, Input, OnInit} from '@angular/core';

@Component({
                    selector: 'app-card',
                    templateUrl: './card.component.html',
                    styleUrls: ['./card.component.scss']
})
export class ExpansionComponent implements OnInit {
                    @Input() public title = '';

                    constructor() { }

  ngOnInit() {
  }

}
Angular template:
                <section class="card">
  <h6 *ngIf="title">{{ title }}</h6>
  <div>
    <ng-content></ng-content>
  </div>
</section>

4. Sidebar navigation

Use the sidebar navigation to allow users to navigate to different sections, and pages within the current section.

Item 1

Item 2

  • Page 1
  • Page 2
  • Page 3
  • Page 4
  • Page 5

Item 3

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<section class="card"> <h6 *ngIf="title">Contact details</h6> <div> <ng-content> <form> <input type="text" placeholder="First name"/><br> <input type="text" placeholder="Last name"/><br> <input type="text" placeholder="Email address"/><br> </form> </ng-content> </div> </section>

Angular component:
                import {Component, Input, OnInit} from '@angular/core';

@Component({
                    selector: 'app-card',
                    templateUrl: './card.component.html',
                    styleUrls: ['./card.component.scss']
})
export class ExpansionComponent implements OnInit {
                    @Input() public title = '';

                    constructor() { }

  ngOnInit() {
  }

}
Angular template:
                <section class="card">
  <h6 *ngIf="title">{{ title }}</h6>
  <div>
    <ng-content></ng-content>
  </div>
</section>

5. Tabs

Use the sidebar navigation to allow users to navigate to different sections, and pages within the current section.

Tab 1

Tab 2

Tab 3

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<section class="card"> <h6 *ngIf="title">Contact details</h6> <div> <ng-content> <form> <input type="text" placeholder="First name"/><br> <input type="text" placeholder="Last name"/><br> <input type="text" placeholder="Email address"/><br> </form> </ng-content> </div> </section>

Angular component:
                import {Component, Input, OnInit} from '@angular/core';

@Component({
                    selector: 'app-card',
                    templateUrl: './card.component.html',
                    styleUrls: ['./card.component.scss']
})
export class ExpansionComponent implements OnInit {
                    @Input() public title = '';

                    constructor() { }

  ngOnInit() {
  }

}
Angular template:
                <section class="card">
  <h6 *ngIf="title">{{ title }}</h6>
  <div>
    <ng-content></ng-content>
  </div>
</section>
